column2: 'Leptobaea' is treated as an orthographic error correctable under Art. 60.1 (ICN 2012). Bentham had three genera in his treatment of Gesneriaceae in Genera Plantarum that incorporated the element "boea" -- each as "baea" (with a diphthong æ): Phyllobæa Benth.
column3: Bæa [sic] Comm. and Leptobæa Benth.  However
column4: Boea (Bentham's Bæa) was published by Lamarck as "Bœa"
column6: Encycl. 1: 401. 1785   Bentham continued his mis-spelling with his own generic names Phylloboea and Leptoboea (using 'bæa' in each case). Each was evidently intended as a modification of Boea -- and as Bentham spelled that name in a different manner from the original spelling
column7: so he also mis-spelled the derived name.%%%%%tax. nov.
